meanings.definition: To instruct or urge someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher enjoined the students to study for their upcoming test.
meanings.sent2: She always enjoined her children to be kind to others.
meanings.sent3: The coach enjoined the team to give their best effort, even if they were tired.
meanings.sent4: The wise elder enjoined the young ones to cherish their time with loved ones.
meanings.sent5: The leader's powerful speech enjoined the crowd to stand up for what they believe in.

meanings.definition: To prohibit or forbid someone from doing something.
meanings.sent1: The sign clearly enjoined visitors from entering the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The rules enjoined the students from using their phones during class.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoined the dog from entering its territory.
meanings.sent4: The law strictly enjoined anyone from trespassing on private property.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell enjoined the evil spirits from causing harm to the village.
